markdownRemark.html: Thanks, Diana. The only true wisdom resides in careful generalization. I tried to set the scene for this in the introduction (especially sections 0.3 to 0.6). To your specific point here, however --yes, it is important to stress both that textbooks offer only a limited view of pedagogy and that pedagogy is not the whole of humanism. I do belong to the school that sees humanism as first and foremost an educational reform movement and only secondarily a literary and philosophical one. But even beyond that difference of starting point, I hope that Humanism For Sale has shown that one of the most important loci for understanding humanism and the humanists is in the defense of their educational program that printed textbooks embody.
